projects.name: Grand Tour GC Riders
imageAltTexts: 'Nationality = Danish' filter applied on the index page
description: A database-backed web app showcasing professional cycling’s top general classification (GC) riders.
As part of my bootcamp, I developed this app without a framework to focus on my understanding of back-end fundamentals, using PHP for server-side logic and MariaDB for database management.
Revisiting the project a year later, I was able to significantly improve the codebase’s robustness and maintainability, demonstrating my growth as a developer.

projects.name: Vancouver Canucks Roster API
description: An API tracking the roster of the Vancouver Canucks ice hockey team.
I used PHP and Laravel to structure the application with design patterns, manage the database and handle complex model relationships.
I implemented HTTP tests to ensure reliability and maintainability, and I created a front-end Blade template to host the API’s documentation.

projects.name: Blackjack
description: A fun, free-to-play online blackjack game.
I used HTML and TailwindCSS to create the interface and plain JavaScript for game logic and DOM manipulation.
I decoupled game logic from the visuals and added features incrementally, starting with basic mechanics and progressing to more complex features, such as wagering, splitting and doubling down.
